metadata.title: CVE-2022-29918 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers Gabriele Svelto, Randell Jesup and the Mozilla FuzzingTeam reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 99. Some of these bugsshowed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effortsome of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 100.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29918` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 100.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 100.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 100.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '100.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
